title: Parametric Survival Test Plans Estimation
labelDistribution: Select a distribution function that fits the data best
labelDistributionParam: Either specify parameter for the chosen Distribution (e.g. shape and size for Weibull or specify time and event percentiles to estimate the distribution parameters)
labelDistParamOption1: Option 1 - Specify the parameter for the selected distribution
shape: specify shape parameter for Weibull, loglogistic, or gamma, or meanlog for lognormal
scale: specify  scale parameter for Weibull, exponential, shape for loglogistic, or gamma, or sdlog for lognormal
labelDistParamOption2: Option 2 - Specify the time and % events (i.e., failures) to compute the parameters for selected distribution
PercentileTime: Specify two comma separated numeric time values (e.g., 100, 500) to use for estimating distribution parameters
PercentileEvent: Specify two comma separated numeric percentile values to event e.g. % failure (10, 30) to use for estimating distribution parameters
parameter: Select Percentile to specify desired percentile event, e.g., % failure. If you leave Percentile empty and select scale, Percentile will automatically be assumed to be 63.2121% for Weibull and exponential, and 50% for all other distributions, if location is selected
p: Percentile (e.g., 10) for the event e.g. failure
precision: Precisions (one or more values comma separated) as distances from bound of CI to estimate
censorTime: Time censor at, if any, e.g., specify 1000
pilotDataLength: Number of data rows to be used for simulations (default 2000)
seed: Randomization seed type any combination of four digits
repeatSampleSizeCalculation: Repeat sample size computations to take average (seed field must be empty)
